name: Green Chilli Pickle
history: Green Chilli Pickle, or 'Hari Mirch ka Achaar' in Hindi, is a popular condiment in Indian cuisine. It's known for its spicy and tangy taste, made by pickling fresh green chilies in a blend of mustard oil, spices, and lemon juice.
description: Green Chilli Pickle is a fiery and tangy Indian pickle made with fresh green chilies. It's seasoned with a mix of mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and other spices, preserved in mustard oil, and often enhanced with lemon or vinegar for tartness.

instructions.title: Prepare the Chilies
instructions.description: Wash and dry the green chilies thoroughly. Slit them lengthwise, keeping them intact at the stem.

instructions.title: Mix Spices and Oil
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix the powdered mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, asafoetida, and salt. Add mustard oil and lemon juice to the spice mixture.

instructions.title: Coat the Chilies
instructions.description: Add the green chilies to the spice and oil mixture. Toss well to ensure the chilies are coated evenly.

instructions.title: Store the Pickle
instructions.description: Transfer the coated chilies to a clean, dry jar. Ensure the jar is airtight. Let the pickle sit for a few days for the flavors to develop and mellow.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Once the pickle has matured, it can be served as an accompaniment to meals. The chilies will soften and absorb the flavors over time.

tips: Ensure the chilies and jar are completely dry to prevent mold.
Adjust the amount of lemon juice to balance the pickle's tanginess.
variations: Add garlic or ginger for additional flavors.
Experiment with different types of green chilies for varying heat levels.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored for up to 6 months in a cool, dry place.
storage.instructions: Use a dry, clean spoon for serving. Keep the jar tightly closed.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl or directly from the jar.
Pair with a traditional Indian thali for an authentic experience.
